question.q1: Q1 - What is correct syntax for main method of a java class?

options.a: A - public static int main(String[] args)
options.c: C - public static void main(String[] args)

question.answer: answer is Option C. Explaination Correct syntax is public static void main(String[] args).

question.q2: Q 2 - What is the size of long variable?
question.answer:
Answer : D Explaination The long data type is represented by 64-bit two's complement integer.
Minimum value: -263
Maximum value: 263-1

question.q3: Q 3 - What is the default value of int variable?
question.answer: Answer : A Explaination int variable has default value of 0 if defined as an instance/static variable.

question.q4: Q 4 - What is the default value of Object variable?
question.answer: Answer : C Explaination Object variable has default value of null if defined as an instance/static variable.

question.q5: Q 5 - What is an immutable object?

options.a: A - An immutable object can be changed once it is created.
options.b: B - An immutable object can't be changed once it is created.
options.c: C - An immutable object is an instance of an abstract class.

question.answer: Answer : B Explaination An immutable object can't be changed once it is created. String objects are immutable.

options.a: A - An applet is a Java program that runs in a Web browser.
options.b: B - Applet is a standalone java program.
options.d: D - Applet is a run time environment.

question.answer: Answer : A Explaination An applet is a Java program that runs in a Web browser.

question.q7: Q 7 - Method Overriding is an example of
question.answer: Answer : B Explaination Method Overriding is example of dynamic Binding.

question.q8: Q 8 - Does garbage collection guarantee that a program will not run out of memory?
question.answer: Answer : B Explaination Garbage collection does not guarantee that a program will not run out of memory. It is possible for programs to use up memory resources faster than they are garbage collected. It is also possible for programs to create objects that are not subject to garbage collection.

question.q9: Q 8 - Under what conditions is an object's finalize() method invoked by the garbage collector?

options.a: A - When it detects that the object has become unreachable.
options.b: B - As soon as object is set as null.
options.c: C - At fixed intervalm it checks for null value.

question.answer: Answer : B Explaination Garbage collection does not guarantee that a program will not run out of memory. It is possible for programs to use up memory resources faster than they are garbage collected. It is also possible for programs to create objects that are not subject to garbage collection.

options.a: A - When it detects that the object has become unreachable.

question.answer: Answer : B Explaination Garbage collection does not guarantee that a program will not run out of memory. question.q10: Q 10 - which operator is considered to be with highest precedence?
question.answer: Answer : A Explaination Postfix operators i.e () [] . is at the highest precedence.
